TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit ControlAdapter extends System.Object implements class System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IControlAdapter

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")

Docs.summary: The ControlAdapter class itself is abstract and cannot be instantiated. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The ControlAdapter class provides a general base class from which control adapters can inherit. This class provides a default implementation of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IControlAdapter> interface required for all adapters. The default rendering implementation of the base class should be to render all child controls. This allows the base class to be used as an adapter for composition controls.

Docs.permission: for operating in a hosted environment. Demand value: ; Permission value: .

Docs.param: The page weight to use if the page weight cannot otherwise be determined.

Docs.returns: The optimum page weight for the device.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The optimum page weight is calculated as 100 times the number of lines of characters. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

Docs.value: A strongly typed reference to the associated control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Control property is an implementation of the Control property for the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IControlAdapter> interface, which gets or sets the control to which the adapter is attached.
For individual control adapters, you can create a strongly typed property to hide the Control property.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void CreateTemplatedUI(bool doDataBind) cil managed

Docs.param: If , the instantiated templates bind to available data (which usually happens on the first request). If , the templates do not bind to data, and instead rely on view state to fill them in (which usually happens on subsequent postbacks).
Docs.summary: Called by a control to create a templated user interface (UI). This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default implementation calls the CreateTemplatedUI method of the corresponding control adapter, which can in turn call back the control's CreateTemplatedUI method or create its own device-specific templated UI.

Docs.summary: Returns the device capabilities object associated with the request. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The device capabilities object associated with the request.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is provided for convenience, and is equivalent to calling the browser using an <xref:System.Web.HttpRequest>, such as <xref:System.Web.HttpRequest.Browser%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig instance string GetDefaultLabel(int32 labelID) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the localized default string for the label control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.returns: The localized default string for the label control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following table shows the values for `labelID` parameters:
|LabelID|Value| |-------------|-----------| |BackLabel|0| |GoLabel|1| |OKLabel|2| |MoreLabel|3| |OptionsLabel|4| |NextLabel|5| |PreviousLabel|6| |LinkLabel|7| |CallLabel|8|

Docs.exception: is less than zero, or greater than or equal to the number of valid values.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool HandlePostBackEvent(string eventArgument) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns if the event was handled. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.returns: if the event was handled; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is called by a control when it receives a postback event notification, to check whether the event is adapter-specific. If the control implements the <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackEventHandler> method and receives a postback event, the <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackEventHandler.RaisePostBackEvent%2A> method of the control adapter is called. If events sent to the control can vary depending on the target device, the control implementation of this method must call the HandlePostBackEvent method of the control adapter.
This method returns `true` or `false`, indicating whether the device adapter handled the event. It returns `false` by default.

Docs.summary: Accesses the approximate weight of a single item in the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The approximate weight of a single item in the control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A value of -1 indicates that the default weight for the element must be used. The inheriting class must override this property. For further information about overriding this property, see [Pagination](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/b4f4c4bc-226b-46ec-ae46-00497a32f4f2).

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is called when the control loads its private view state. A device adapter can save the adapter-specific view for a control.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool LoadPostData (string key, System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection data, object controlPrivateData, out bool dataChanged);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool LoadPostData(string key, class System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection data, object controlPrivateData, bool dataChanged) cil managed

Docs.param: Contains the collection of all incoming name values.
Provides a place to send data private to the control that might be required for loading of post data. The control determines the type that is passed to the parameter.
Returns if the required the object in `privateControlData` was changed, so the <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler.RaisePostDataChangedEvent%2A> event can be raised.
Docs.summary: Returns if the adapter handles loading the post data. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.returns: if the adapter handles loading the post data; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is called when a control that implements the <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler?displayProperty=fullName> interface has its own <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler.LoadPostData%2A> method invoked.
> [!NOTE] > Different devices might provide their data back to the calling server in different ways. An example is the difference between how WML and HTML report back the results of a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList>

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnInit(class System.EventArgs e) cil managed

Docs.param: An object (defined by <xref:System.EventArgs>) that contains event data.
Docs.summary: Called after an object, such as a form or a page, is initialized. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can override this method to set device-specific properties. Inheriting classes can override this method to perform other tasks. If this method is overridden in an inheriting class, you must call the base implementation.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnLoad(class System.EventArgs e) cil managed

Docs.param: An object (defined by <xref:System.EventArgs>) that contains event data.
Docs.summary: Loads data that pertains to a control, a page, or a device adapter. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The OnLoad method is inherited from the control's parent. If the control is a mobile server control, this method is inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control?displayProperty=fullName> class; if the control is a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage>, this method is inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page?displayProperty=fullName> class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnUnload(class System.EventArgs e) cil managed

Docs.param: An object (defined by <xref:System.EventArgs>) that contains event data.
Docs.summary: Unloads data that pertains to a control, a page, or a device adapter. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl> base class implementation calls the OnUnload method of the control adapter. The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage> base class implementation calls the OnUnload method of the page adapter.

remarks.format: ## Remarks An adapter can save adapter-specific state for a control. If no such functionality is required, the adapter returns `null`.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the approximate weight of the control, in characters. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The approximate weight of the control, in characters

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is used for form pagination. A value of -1 indicates that the default weight for the element must be used. For further information, see [Pagination](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/b4f4c4bc-226b-46ec-ae46-00497a32f4f2).
